choices.text: Purple rain falls in the magic kingdom of Linearland which is a straight, thin peninsula. On close observation however, Prof. Nelson Rogers finds that actually it is a mix of Red and Blue drops. In his zeal, he records the location and color of the raindrops in different locations along the peninsula. Looking at the data, Professor Rogers wants to know which part of Linearland had the least purple rain. After some thought, he decides to model this problem as follows. Divide the peninsula into $n$ sections and number them West to East from $1$ to $n$. Then, describe the raindrops as a sequence of R and B, depending on whether the rainfall in each section is primarily red or blue. Finally, find a subsequence of where the difference between the number of R and the number of B is maximized.
